name: Vietnam Package 17 Days 16 Nights
description: Explore the best of Vietnam from North to South in this comprehensive 17-day journey. Experience the vibrant culture of Hanoi, the stunning landscapes of Ninh Binh and Halong Bay, the mountainous beauty of Sapa, the historic charm of Hue and Hoi An, and the tropical paradise of Phu Quoc Island.

itinerary.title: Ha Noi Arrival
itinerary.content:
Hanoi arrival
Check in hotel
You have free and easy time to explore.

itinerary.title: Ha Noi City Tour
itinerary.content:
After breakfast, you will get picked up by your tour leader then head to the destination.

Hoan Kiem Lake: Enjoy a relaxing walk around Hanoi's iconic lake, the heart of the city.

The Old Quarter (36 Streets): Explore the bustling Old Quarter and visit its most vibrant streets such as:
• Ta Hien Street: The famous "Beer Street," where locals and tourists gather to enjoy the lively nightlife.
• Hang Dao Street: Known for local fashion, silk, and traditional souvenirs.
• Hang Gai Street: Also called "Silk Street," perfect for shopping high-quality silk products and tailor-made clothes.

St. Joseph's Cathedral: Admire the beautiful neo-Gothic architecture inspired by Notre Dame de Paris.

Train Street: Experience the unique spot where trains pass through a narrow residential street — a must-see photo stop in Hanoi.

18:00: Enjoy Bún Chả, a famous Vietnamese specialty dish. Then come back to the hotel.

itinerary.title: Ninh Binh
itinerary.content:
08:00: After breakfast, our guide will meet you at your hotel/stay and start a 110km modern bus-journey through the verdant landscape of the countryside. Short-brake en route.

10:15: Visit Hoa Lu Ancient Citadel with Dinh King Temple and Le King Temple dating back to the 17th Century.

11:30: Leisure cycling on rural roads alongside the extensive canal network and through small villages with the backdrop of a maze of limestone mountains.

12:15: We will have a buffet lunch at the restaurant with a lot of local foods like goat meat and fried rice. Vegetarian food is always available at the buffet lunch.

13:00: Visit Trang An, which was recognized by UNESCO as a World Heritage Site in 2014. This remarkable landscape features a network of tunnel caves that captivated filmmakers, inspiring the iconic "Kong: Skull Island" – 2016.
Boat trip to visit Trang An to see the amazing beauty of this landscape with many caves such as: Sang Cave (Light Cave), Toi Cave (Dark cave), Nau Ruou Cave (Cooking Wine), green river and natural view.

15:15: Get on the bus to go to Hang Mua (Mua Cave). Walk up almost 500 steps, you can reach the top of Lying Dragon Mountain, and have an amazing panoramic view of Tam Coc from here.

17:15: Get on the bus then come back to Hanoi.

19:30: Drop you off at your hotel. Trip ends.

itinerary.title: Ha Long Bay
itinerary.content:
08:30: After hotel breakfast, our limousine will pick you up at the hotel and transfer to Quang Ninh, stopping over for a rest on the way.

11:45-12:00: Arrival at Tuan Chau Island. Welcome aboard and have Vietnamese traditional Lunch with seafood while cruising though the amazing rocks: Incense Burner, Cock Fighting…

13:30: Explore Sung Sot Cave (Surprising cave): The longest, biggest and the most beautiful cave of Halong Bay. Perched 25 meters above the sea, Sung Sot Caves stretch across 10,000 square meters. A mesmerizing 800-meter stone pathway, bathed in the glow of colorful lanterns, winds through the cavern's depths, revealing its hidden wonders.

14:45: Explore Luon Cave, a stunning water cave, by kayak or bamboo boat. Relax and soak in the serene beauty of the surroundings.

15:45: Visit Titop Island for swimming, sunbathing, or trekking to the peak for panoramic views of the bay.

16:30: Back to cruise. Enjoy a Sunset party on the sundeck with Red wine, French fries, cakes, Fruits...

17:45-18:00: Back to Ha Long harbor.

20:30: Drop you off at your Hanoi hotel. Trip ends.

itinerary.title: Ha Noi - Sa Pa Cat Cat
itinerary.content:
06:30: Our sleeping bus will pick you up at the hotel.
If you don't have enough time, you can take away breakfast.

09:00: The car stops along the highway for you to rest and have breakfast. Don't forget to enjoy the beautiful scenery along the way!

13:30: Sapa town arrival! Firstly drop-off your luggage at the hotel then the tour guide will take you for lunch. After a short rest, you will get into the car to start visiting Cat Cat Village.

14:30: The tour guide takes you for a walk to visit Cat Cat village where the Black H'mong people live, a charming place in the valley located at the foot of the majestic Fansipan peak. The local tour guide will introduce you to the daily life of the ethnic people here, then you continue walking to Cat Cat waterfall, Cat Cat hydroelectric station built by the French in the early years of the century.
You can take commemorative photos wearing local costumes (surcharge not included in the trip).

16:30: Experience the Alpine Coaster in Sapa – enjoy an exciting ride while taking in panoramic views of the mountains and town.

17:30: Return to Sapa town.

19:00: Dinner at a local restaurant.
Free time in the evening to explore Sapa town:
• Visit Sapa Stone Church
• Explore Sapa Night Market
• Enjoy local grilled specialties

Return to the hotel and rest, preparing for the next day's journey.

itinerary.title: Fansipan Peak - Hanoi
itinerary.content:
08:00: After breakfast, our guide will pick you up at the hotel. Transfer to the Cable car station. You will see Muong Hoa valley, Hoang Lien Son mountain in a beautiful sea of clouds from the cable car. Fansipan peak is 3,143m high, the highest mountain of the Indochinese peninsula (including Laos & Cambodia). It takes 15 mins by cable car and climbing about 600 steps to reach the peak.

From Fansipan peak, enjoy the view of: Hoang Lien Son majestic wild forest, mountain ranges, and Muong Hoa Valley. Take a photo to save this memorable moment. Then you return to the cable car station to move down.

If you choose to walk down instead, you can stop to visit Bao An Thien Tu, Bich Van Thien Tu, the huge copper Buddha Statue & Guanyin Statue.

11:30: Return to the town.

12:00: Check out then have lunch. It's your free time to exploring and shopping.

13:30: Back to Hanoi by sleeping bus

20:00: Hotel drop-off. Trip ends.

itinerary.title: Hanoi - Incense Village - Flight to Da Nang
itinerary.content:
07:00 - 08:00: Breakfast at hotel

08:00 - 09:30: Transfer to Quang Phu Cau Incense Village

09:30 - 11:00: Visit the traditional incense-making village
• Learn about the handmade incense process
• Photo stop with colorful incense bundles

11:30 - 12:30: Lunch at local restaurant

14:00: Transfer to Noi Bai Airport. Flight to Da Nang

Check-in Hotel.
Overnight in Da Nang.

itinerary.title: Ba Na Hill
itinerary.content:
07:00-08:15: Our tour guide will pick you up at your hotel in Da Nang Central.

08:30: We will stop at a traditional craft village to make a list and prepare tickets for our visit. This is on the same route to Ba Na Hill.

09:45-10:00: We will arrive at the entrance of Ba Na Hills and board the world's longest 1-rope cable car to the romantic French Village.

10:30: We will visit the Lunar Castle, Eclipse Square, and watch movies at Mat Bay Theatre, the most modern Moon Junction Theatre in the world.

11:45-13:00: We will have a buffet lunch at a restaurant.

13:15: We will enjoy mini shows and take photos with the sparkling golden Sun World Globe, as well as explore the fun Fantasy Park.

14:45: We will take a short cable car ride from the French Village to The Golden Bridge, where we can admire hundreds of blooming flowers at Le Jardin flower garden.

16:15-16:30: Return to the cable car and head to the Time Gate.
Our bus will be ready to take us back to the hotel or meeting point.
(There will be no shopping at the end of the day)

itinerary.title: Hoi An
itinerary.content:
13:00: Tour guide will pick you up at your hotel.

Start your adventure with Cam Thanh Coconut for being a fisherman at Cam Thanh Coconut Village, you will experience learning traditional fishing techniques and how to row unique Vietnamese bamboo basket boats while exploring the tranquil coconut palm waterways of the past war. On this tour, we provide authentic social and cultural insights into the local way of life in Vietnam. Furthermore, you will take part in some hands-on activities which are fun, safe, and interesting and are suitable for everybody.

14:30: Visit to the next destination to Hoi An Old Town:

Go to Phuc Kien Chinese Assembly Hall, a colorful melange of bright gates, dragon statues, and elaborate rooftops. Get an introduction to ancestor worship while visiting the family altar and watching local devotees making offerings.

You will see remarkably well-preserved old houses, Phung Hung Ancient House or Tan Ky Ancient House that have withstood 200 years of weather and war. Learn about the prosperous merchants who used to live in these homes, trading with buyers from all around the world. Visit Museum of Folk Culture in Hoi An. A display of artifacts depicts ancient local daily life. You will especially enjoy art shows at Hoi An Traditional Performing Arts House.

Make a stop at the Japanese Bridge. The bridge spans a small waterway and was constructed more than 400 years ago to connect the Japanese community with the Chinese who lived on the other side of the water. Admire the carvings and paintings inside the bridge, learning about their symbolism and cultural significance.

Additionally, visit some of Hoi An's well-known handicraft shops and artwork galleries. Discover smaller laneways and local neighborhoods, gaining a better appreciation of Hoi An's endless charm.

Dinner with Hoi An specialty food.

18:00: Enjoy your time with the boat ride on Hoai River and release the flower lanterns to pray for the best of luck to you and your family. You will immerse yourself in the fanciful space of the lantern street. Free your time with the night market and enjoy the shimmering space of Hoi An.

itinerary.title: Da Nang City Tour
itinerary.content:
16:00: Hotel Pick-up. Our friendly guide and driver will meet you at your hotel in Da Nang city center. Let's begin your exciting night journey through Da Nang!

16:30 – 17:00: Visit Linh Ung Pagoda
Located on Son Tra Peninsula, Linh Ung Pagoda features Vietnam's tallest Lady Buddha statue (67m), overlooking the East Sea. A sacred and a peaceful place surrounded by nature.

17:00 – 18:00: Explore Da Nang's Highlights
• Dragon Bridge – The iconic symbol of Da Nang, famous for its fire and water shows on weekends.
• Love Lock Bridge – A romantic spot with heart-shaped lanterns and a place to "lock" your love.
• Han Market – A lively traditional market offering local specialties and souvenirs.

18:00 – 19:00: Enjoy Local Dinner
You will enjoy a traditional Vietnamese dinner with one of the following choices:
• Mi Quang – A Central Vietnam specialty made with turmeric noodles, pork, shrimp, fresh herbs and peanuts.
• Pho – Vietnam's national dish with savory broth, soft noodles, and tender beef or chicken.

19:00 – 20:00: Han River Cruise – Da Nang by Night
Board a comfortable cruise along the Han River. Admire the sparkling cityscape, illuminated bridges, and the vibrant nightlife from a new perspective.

20:30: Drop-off at Hotel – End of Tour

itinerary.title: Hue
itinerary.content:
08:00 - 08:30: Your tour guide will pick you up at your hotel in Da Nang. Along the way, there will be a stop at the highest point, the Hai Van Pass. Here you will see a panoramic view of Da Nang city and the beautiful long white Lang Co Beach.

11:30: Visit one of the most aesthetic royal tombs, Khai Dinh Tomb. This jaw dropping blend of Western and Eastern architecture was constructed between 1920-1931 for the 12th emperor of the Nguyen Dynasty – Emperor Khai Dinh.

12:30: Enjoy a delicious lunch at a local restaurant serving the best Hue dishes.

13:30: Explore the Citadel - one of the UNESCO Heritage Sites in Vietnam.
Important Reminder: Please wear clothes that cover your knees when visiting this place.

15:00: Get amazed at the beautiful Thien Mu Pagoda, the tallest pagoda in Vietnam. Due to its beauty, it became a common subject to many local folk rhymes and is considered the unofficial symbol of Hue.

16:00: End of Hue City Tour.
Then fly to Ho Chi Minh city, check in at a hotel. Free time to explore.

itinerary.title: Saigon City Tour - Cu Chi Tunnel
itinerary.content:
08:00 – 08:30: After enjoying breakfast at your hotel, start your day by exploring the vibrant city of Saigon and its most famous attractions:

• War Remnants Museum – Discover historical exhibits from the First Indochina War and the Vietnam War.
• Reunification Palace – A remarkable national monument where many significant historical events took place, including the Liberation of the South and the reunification of Vietnam on April 30, 1975.
• Notre-Dame Cathedral Basilica of Saigon – Built between 1863 and 1880 by French colonists, this iconic church is one of the city's most beautiful landmarks.
• Saigon Central Post Office – A striking architectural gem from the late 19th century, designed during the French colonial era, located right next to the Notre-Dame Cathedral.

12:00: Enjoy lunch at a local restaurant and take a short rest.

13:00: Depart for Cu Chi Tunnels – an incredible underground network used during the Vietnam War.
• Watch a short documentary about Cu Chi during the war.
• Experience walking through parts of the tunnel system.
• Taste the traditional dish tapioca and enjoy pandan leaf tea.
• Try rifle shooting (optional, with an additional charge).

19:00: Return to your hotel in Ho Chi Minh City. Free time to relax or explore the city at your own pace in the evening.

itinerary.title: Mekong Delta
itinerary.content:
07:30: After hotel breakfast, you will be taken to My Tho wharf, the motorboat takes you on the Tien River, pass by floating fish farm villages, and the RACH MIEU bridge a cable-stayed bridge spanning the Tien River and linking the two provinces of Tien Giang (My Tho) and Ben Tre together, and four islands: Long, Lan, Qui, Phung. Stop by Con Lan (Unicorn Island) to visit the local honeybee farm and taste the unique honey tea.

After that, the electric cart will escort you to the fruit garden where you can try out the fresh tropical fruits (seasonal) and listen to traditional Southern music. Next, experience the taste of the Mekong Delta when sitting on a rowing boat, weaving into the small canal, watching rows of water coconuts, and the simple landscape of the Mekong Delta.

Returning to the big boat, along the Tien River, the motorboat will take you to the province of Ben Tre, which is known as the "Vietnamese coconut island" to visit the specialty of Ben Tre's coconut candy oven.

12:00: Take a motorboat to the restaurant to have lunch with typical dishes of the Mekong Delta. Rest and bike around the village (optional).

14:00: The motorboat takes you back to My Tho wharf. On the way back, visit Vinh Trang Pagoda, known as "the largest temple in Tien Giang"

18:00: Tour ends. Return to Saigon hotel and you have free time for the rest of the evening.

itinerary.title: Ho Chi Minh to Phu Quoc
itinerary.content:
Enjoy Breakfast

Fly to Phu Quoc Island, the tropical paradise of Vietnam, and spend the day freely exploring its stunning beaches, vibrant markets, and natural beauty at your own pace.

itinerary.title: 4 Island Land
itinerary.content:
08:00 - 09:00: Pick up from your hotel and transfer to Anh Duong Cable Car Station (located in Sunset Town)

09:15: Board the cable car and enjoy a scenic ride to Hon Thom Island

Have fun at Aquatopia Water Park and Exotica Theme Park with unlimited access to thrilling rides and slides. Enjoy a lunch buffet at a restaurant on Hon Thom Island.

16:30-17:00: Take the cable car back to Anh Duong Cable Car Station.

Visit the iconic Kiss Bridge Phu Quoc, a must-see attraction.
